intro: Basanacantha inermis, commonly known as the smooth spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often clustered leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with simple, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Basanacantha inermis is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a common sight in dryland ecosystems.
